newsitem.title: USA: SNET buys 63.5 pct balance of Woodbury.
newsitem.headline: SNET buys 63.5 pct balance of Woodbury.

text.p: Southern New England Telecommunications Corp and Woodbury Telephone Co said on Tuesday they have agreed in principle to let SNET buy the remaining 63.5 percent of outstanding Woodbury in a deal of about $30 million.
Woodbury common shareholders would exchange each outstanding Woodbury share for SNET common shares having a market value of $43.00 at closing, subject to certain conditions, the companies said.
The deal is expected to be tax-free and close by mid-1997. It is subject to Woodbury shareholder and regulatory approval.
